thread.title: Bradley Cooper Reacts to Amy Schumer's 'SNL' Engagement Announcement
thread.title_full: Bradley Cooper Reacts to Amy Schumer's 'SNL' Engagement Announcement

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Bradley Cooper Reacts to Amy Schumer's 'SNL' Engagement Announcement
text:
Comments Bradley weighs in on the engagement announcement Amy made on 'Saturday Night Live', 'I thought it was gonna be a secret but she just decided to let the cat out of the bag.' 
Bradley Cooper weighed in on Amy Schumer 's faux engagement announcement during her monologue on " Saturday Night Live ". The hunky actor recently told Access Hollywood that he wished they could have announced the happy news together. "I thought it was gonna be a secret but she just decided to let the cat out of the bag," the 40-year-old actor jokingly told the news outlet. Bradley then said that he texted Amy following the show. "I texted with her after. I was like, 'That was hilarious.' " It wasn't the first time Amy included his name into her story. "The truth is I remember I met her and then she was on a talk show and made up some story that I pretended to avoid her," he explained. Later on, Bradley called out the stand-up comedian when the two met at the TIME 100 gala red carpet. "And when I saw her on the red carpet I was like, 'Hey man, you made up some bulls**t story,' and she was like 'Oh I'm sorry,' " the actor explained with a laugh. Bradley assumed that the faux engagement was to make up for the false story about him in the past. "So maybe she's making up for that now ... cause I called her on it," he said. "It was like, 'Dude, what are you talking about?' " During her monologue on "SNL", Amy said, "Am I dating Bradley Cooper? And I changed my Facebook status. Well I'm not complicated [but] I'm engaged to Bradley Cooper." She had previously recounted similar story about dating the actor minus engagement announcement on " The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon ".
